title: How Many Calories Are in Theater Popcorn?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in theater popcorn—a small serving typically has 400 kcal—plus carbs, fat, protein, sodium, and preparation tweaks for better choices.
h1: How Many Calories Are in Theater Popcorn?
assumptions: Small serving (~85 g or 11 cups), popped in coconut oil with moderate butter flavoring, as commonly served at major theater chains.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by chain (e.g., AMC, Regal), exact portion, butter amount, and flavorings. Values are averages; check theater nutrition info when available.

quick_answer.text: A small serving of theater popcorn has about 400 calories, mostly from fat and carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Air-popped at home (similar volume, no oil/butter)

faqs.q: How many calories are in a small theater popcorn?
faqs.a: About 400 kcal for a typical small serving with butter flavoring.

faqs.q: Is theater popcorn high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, around 25 g total fat per small serving, mainly from popping oil and butter.

faqs.q: How much sodium in theater popcorn?
faqs.a: Approximately 600 mg per small serving, from salt and flavorings.

faqs.q: What's the difference between plain and buttered theater popcorn calories?
faqs.a: Buttered adds 100-200 kcal; plain is closer to 250 kcal per small serving.

faqs.q: How many calories in a large theater popcorn?
faqs.a: A large can be 800-1200 kcal or more, depending on size and toppings—often double or triple a small.
